intro: Oenothera albinervis, commonly known as the white-veined evening primrose, is a herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that open in the evening. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with distinct white veins. Its flowers are typically borne in clusters at the ends of the stems, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Oenothera albinervis is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
